document_data.name: Tufala bint Maneira
document_data.mainbody: '''Tufala bint Maneira''' was a [[half-elven]] [[rawun]] inhabiting the [[High Desert]] of [[Zakhara]] around [[1367 DR]]{{AQ-time}} who related the history of her desert tribe through her stories and music.{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1993|42|[[Tufala bint Maneira]]}}
document_data.Activites: Tufala inherited her duties as the tribal storyteller and historian from her [[elven]] mother. She took her responsibilities seriously. She was well-informed about current rumors of the High Desert.
document_data.Possessions: Tufala wore [[leather armor]] and carried an enchanted ''[[jambiya]]'' and a normal [[cutlass]]. She played her ''[[pipes of sounding]]'' to help relate her stories.
